page.title: 16Hatfield Broad Oak Life: 1
page.content: { Life in the village as seen { by an eleven year girl. One advantage of living in the country is that there is much less traffic and therefore it is much quieter; but there are lots of disadvantages as well. I think the main one is that because it is such a small village there are not many shops. My usual day goes like this: get up at 8 am, get dressed into my school uniform which consists of blue jumper, blue skirt, blue or white shirt, white socks and black lace-up shoes (they're in fashion!) and go down to breakfast at about 8.15 am. I always have branflakes, never cornflakes, which I would prefer sometimes for a change! At 8.55 am approximately I leave home to go to school.{Continued on page 17. {}
